ABOUT ME

I'm creative Software Developer

Ashish Singh


I am a 1st year student in the Biostatistics and Medical Informatics MS program at University of Wisconsin-Madison. I have four years of work experience with Siemens Healthcare starting as a Software Engineer in their Imaging Team and developing annotation tools. Later, I moved into the role of Data Analyst and worked on developing Recommender Systems, Image Classifiers and Statistical Models. I am well versed in Algorithms, Data Structures, Machine Learning, Statistical Methods and Cloud Computing.

I collaborate with peers to nurture and transform ideas into well thought out design specs. I love coding things from scratch, but I can work with frameworks and third party libraries.

Over the years, I have consistently participated in various events and competitions. Some of them are listed below:
- Third National Rank in International Olympiad of Mathematics, 2011
- Chief Event Manager at the annual technical fest Renaissance 2013 structured by the IET where my responsibilities included Event Designing, Marketing and Overall Management
- In November 2017, participated in FHIR DevDays held in Amsterdam to understand the upcoming FHIR standard and how it can be utilized to enhance the product
- Represented the product Desktop Connector for profiles WIC and PDC at IHE Connectathon Europe, 2018
- Participated in the FHIR Connectathon held in Cologne wherein worked closely with WG-20 co-chair Elliot Silver and FHIRcast track lead Isaac Vetter to implement this new version specification. In these two days of rigorous testing and discussion, found some issues to refine and enhance the specification

I also received the Star Performer Award in 2018 for quickly learning and proposing a user experience model for implementing the UI design in multiple projects. In 2016, I was recognised for demonstrating excellent analytical skills for Customer issues and closing them with good quality. Analysed more than 50 customer issues in less than five months.

During the past three years, I got multiple opportunities to interact with hospital administrators and doctors:
- At Breda, Netherlands demonstrated the Radiology Decision Support application prototype developed using FHIR to the hospital administration
- Highly appreciated for resolving the integration issue between the NGI RIS system and imaging platform at Imagerie Paris Center, France
- At UMCG, single handedly presented the product to the Doctors and Hospital administrators. Impressed with the solution proposed, UMCG administration placed a contract immediately. For that developed a PSL solution to integrate the syngo.via with the in-house built management system

FUN@WORK

When I am not coding, I love to play chess, table tennis and cricket. I have partcipated in various team events organised at workplace.
